images.caption: Figure 1:As discussed in Section4.1, PGMR first employs an LLM to produce an intermediate query, where the URI labels are framed by "starturi" and "enduri" tokens (Section4.1.1). The retriever (Section4.1.2) subsequently fetches and replaces these labels with the most similar URIs from the non-parametric memory to create the final SPARQL query.
Figure 2:To teach the LLM, the training data is first converted from (a) SPARQL to (b) intermediate queries, as detailed in Section4.1.1

Figure 3:The retriever finds each natural language URI label in the generated intermediate query using the special tokens and retrieves the corresponding URI from memory using similarity search, as discussed in Section4.1.2
